title: Feature Request: Implement entered and exited on iOS / Android
body:
### Description

Currently iOS is implemented only on UWP (because it is connected as a passthrough), but it would be useful to have this functionality connected on iOS/Android (not least because their absence isn't noted and is a bit confusing).  Specifically we are using Skia to generate graphics buttons, and replicating the touch up inside functionality is difficult otherwise.

The implementation would be an interception of "moved", and checking if the touch is inside of the view (and if had previously left). I'm unable to build the repository at the moment, but the implementation would be relatively simple:

```
On touch started:
  IsInside = true  

On Touch moved:
  if touch position is outside view bounds, and IsInside is true
    IsInside = false
    fire touch exited
  else if position is inside view bounds, and IsInside is false
    IsInside = true
    fire touch entered
```

> VS bug [#736301](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/736301)
